meanings.sent1: The rotch from the garbage bin made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: I wrinkled my nose at the rotch coming from the old fridge.
meanings.sent3: The rotch in the bathroom was so bad, we had to open all the windows.
meanings.sent4: The rotch in the alley was like a cloud of stink that followed you.
meanings.sent5: The rotch in the room was so strong, you could almost see it.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of decay or decomposition.
meanings.sent1: The fruit started to rotch on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: Leaves rotch on the ground during autumn.
meanings.sent3: If you leave food out too long, it will start to rotch.
meanings.sent4: The old house began to rotch away, piece by piece.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned car slowly started to rotch in the field.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is worthless or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: He was considered a rotch by everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was now just a rotch in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The old computer became a rotch after the new model was released.
meanings.sent4: To him, the painting was just a rotch taking up space.
meanings.sent5: The rusty bike was seen as a rotch by the kids in the neighborhood.
